# Azure Synapse Cost Analysis per Component

This notebook queries the **Azure Cost Management API** to retrieve and display the cost breakdown
for each component (resource / service) inside the `edhgithubazsyn` Azure Synapse Analytics workspace.

**Authentication**: Uses the workspace **Managed Identity** (no hard-coded credentials).

| Parameter | Value |
|-----------|-------|
| Subscription ID | `d64a14f7-ec67-4f98-88a2-de8617d551a9` |
| Resource Group  | `edhgithubazrg` |
| Synapse Workspace | `edhgithubazsyn` |

# ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
# Cell 1 – Configuration
# ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

SUBSCRIPTION_ID  = "d64a14f7-ec67-4f98-88a2-de8617d551a9"
RESOURCE_GROUP   = "edhgithubazrg"
SYNAPSE_WORKSPACE = "edhgithubazsyn"

# Billing scope – resource-group level gives costs for all resources in the group
SCOPE = f"subscriptions/{SUBSCRIPTION_ID}/resourceGroups/{RESOURCE_GROUP}"

# Cost Management API version
API_VERSION = "2023-03-01"

# Look-back window (last 30 days)
LOOKBACK_DAYS = 30

print(f"Scope  : {SCOPE}")
print(f"Period : last {LOOKBACK_DAYS} days")

# ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
# Cell 3 – Obtain an access token via Managed Identity (IMDS)
# ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

def get_access_token() -> str:
    """
    Retrieve an Azure AD access token for 'https://management.azure.com/'
    using the Azure Instance Metadata Service (IMDS) Managed Identity endpoint.
    No credentials need to be stored in the notebook.
    """
    imds_url = "http://169.254.169.254/metadata/identity/oauth2/token"
    params = {
        "api-version": "2018-02-01",
        "resource": "https://management.azure.com/"
    }
    headers = {"Metadata": "true"}

    resp = requests.get(imds_url, params=params, headers=headers, timeout=30)
    resp.raise_for_status()
    token = resp.json()["access_token"]
    print("Access token obtained successfully via Managed Identity.")
    return token


access_token = get_access_token()

# ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
# Cell 5 – Parse the response into a Pandas DataFrame
# ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

def parse_cost_response(response: dict) -> pd.DataFrame:
    """
    Convert the Cost Management API JSON response into a tidy Pandas DataFrame.
    """
    props = response.get("properties", {})
    columns = [col["name"] for col in props.get("columns", [])]
    rows    = props.get("rows", [])

    if not rows:
        print("No cost data returned for the selected time period.")
        return pd.DataFrame(columns=columns)

    df = pd.DataFrame(rows, columns=columns)

    # Normalise numeric cost columns
    for col in ["Cost", "CostUSD"]:
        if col in df.columns:
            df[col] = pd.to_numeric(df[col], errors="coerce").round(4)

    # Shorten ResourceId to just the resource name for readability
    if "ResourceId" in df.columns:
        df["ResourceName"] = df["ResourceId"].str.split("/").str[-1]

    # Sort by cost descending so the most expensive component is on top
    sort_col = "CostUSD" if "CostUSD" in df.columns else "Cost"
    df = df.sort_values(sort_col, ascending=False).reset_index(drop=True)

    return df


cost_df = parse_cost_response(cost_response)
print(f"Total rows returned: {len(cost_df)}")
cost_df.head()

# ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
# Cell 6 – Summarise costs by Synapse component / service
# ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

if not cost_df.empty:
    # ── Per-service summary ────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    group_col  = "ServiceName" if "ServiceName" in cost_df.columns else cost_df.columns[0]
    value_col  = "CostUSD"     if "CostUSD"     in cost_df.columns else "Cost"
    currency   = cost_df["Currency"].iloc[0] if "Currency" in cost_df.columns else "USD"

    service_summary = (
        cost_df
        .groupby(group_col)[value_col]
        .sum()
        .reset_index()
        .rename(columns={value_col: f"Total Cost ({currency})"})
        .sort_values(f"Total Cost ({currency})", ascending=False)
        .reset_index(drop=True)
    )

    total = service_summary[f"Total Cost ({currency})"].sum()

    print(f"\n{'═'*60}")
    print(f"  Cost breakdown for resource group : {RESOURCE_GROUP}")
    print(f"  Synapse workspace                 : {SYNAPSE_WORKSPACE}")
    print(f"  Period                            : {start_dt}  →  {end_dt}")
    print(f"{'═'*60}")
    print(service_summary.to_string(index=False))
    print(f"{'─'*60}")
    print(f"  TOTAL                               {total:.4f} {currency}")
    print(f"{'═'*60}\n")

    # ── Per-resource detail ────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    display_cols = [c for c in ["ServiceName", "ResourceName", "ResourceType", "CostUSD", "Cost", "Currency"] if c in cost_df.columns]
    print("Detailed cost per resource:")
    print(cost_df[display_cols].to_string(index=False))
else:
    print("No billing data available for the configured scope and time window.")

# ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
# Cell 7 – Convert to a Spark DataFrame and persist as a Delta table (optional)
# ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

if not cost_df.empty:
    spark_df = spark.createDataFrame(cost_df)

    # Show in Synapse output pane
    spark_df.show(truncate=False)

    # Uncomment the lines below to write results to the default storage account
    # output_path = f"abfss://synapse@edhgithubazstosyn.dfs.core.windows.net/cost_analysis/run={start_dt}"
    # spark_df.write.mode("overwrite").format("delta").save(output_path)
    # print(f"Results saved to: {output_path}")
else:
    print("Nothing to persist – cost DataFrame is empty.")
